Deze CARM is een blend van 40% Touriga Nacional, 30% Tinga Roriz en 30% Touriga Franca. De Nacional is een druif met veel karakter en wordt gezien als het Portugees antwoord op Cabernet Sauvignon. De tannines van de Nacional worden verzacht door de Touriga Franca. Deze is vooral geliefd door zijn exotische aroma. Tinta Roriz is het Portugese synoniem voor Tempranillo, bekend van de Spaanse Rioja's.

This wine has a deep and rich crimson colour with thick legs and no rim variation. Subtle in aroma at first, bit of blueberry upon opening the bottle, then with some time more aromas of flowers and baking spices. Medium bodied and despite little fruit aroma there was plenty of dark fruit flavours, oak, some spice, and burnt sugar rounding it all out. Long dusty finish with smoke, leather, and cedar. This is a beautiful wine full of complex aromas, flavour, all with a smooth texture and dry finish.

Winemaking:
Aged 15 months in French oak barrels.
Grape Varieties:
Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional, Tinta Barroca
Tasting Notes:
A powerful red from Portugal, with rich, ripe flavors of dark plum, cocoa powder and raspeberry. Very creamy on the finish, with a lush note of milk chocolate.
Store and Serve Advices:
Best served at a temperature between 17 ¬∫ C and 19 ¬∫ C.
Food Pairing:
Goes well with red meat dishes as well as spicy and cured sheep cheeses.

A fair-value Portuguese red by a good winery in the Douro. It's delightfully fragrant, bursting with ripe cherries, blackberries and blueberries, supported by a meaty touch, light baking spices and a refreshing pinch of medicinal herbs. Medium(+) acidity and tannins give the necessary backbone, and it finishes quite long. A bit too high in alcohol for me personally (14.5%), but the wine itself can handle it. A good red meat partner for summer barbecues or stews, to drink now or maybe give 1 or 2 more years.

A very lovely blend of 7 Portuguese grapes with fantastic deep purple red colour. Very intense aromas of cherries, plums, blueberries & delicate spices. Also on the palate very intense, layers of different fruity, spicy & subtle sweety concentrated flavours. It's a complex, well structured wine with great balance, silky and soft round tannins. All these flavours fully fill the mouth¬† with pure pleasure which lead to pronounced finish and savourty aftertaste. Much better then vintage '10. So, drink it young.

This is a beautiful blend of several local Douro varieties (and touring nacional playing only a supporting role) with lovely ripe black fruit aromas and plenty of black cherry on a long, well-balanced finish. Wonderfully eclectic wine.

My second Portugese wine (not counting Ports) and again Im impressed. This wine is well under $20 and is a solid choice with a lamb ragu.

4.2 Very good wine from Douro. On the nose - vanilla, chocolate, oak, tobacco, vegetal notes. On the palate - cherry, vanilla, blueberry, oak. Gentle, very pleasant tannins and nice long finish. Second time that I'm tasting this wine. This wine presents wine as I love it: a nose that is fully alive, a dark colour where you can see and feel the effect of the sun and a mouth that is full, rich and has some tannines in it. A real treat if you ask me. Nose: cherries / dark chocolate / violet candy / rosemary / alcohol. Mouth: warm / chocolate all over / brown sugar / grapes and has a long finish. Definitely worth having in your cellar!

Full body wine this well balanced wood. Dense red-ruby color with some purple. Red and black fruit and some spices you can easily find in this fantastic wine. A complex and well structured red wine. Very subtle wine. Great character.

This opened big on the nose with red fruits and hint of oak. On the palate, tannins hold you tightly but never too grippy. It softened with time in the glass. Strange thing happened when we left it vacuumed overnight. It turned horribly wrong. It was flaccid. However, after another night, it softened and became enjoyable again. First time a wine recovered after failing.

Deep purple red wine from Portugal. Ripe fruit on the nose with hints of blackberry with a slight floral aroma. Silky smooth on the front with a noticeable oak. This well balanced wine moves effortlessly through to a long, long finish.  I opened it one evening and had about half, then finished it the next day after leaving it stopped but not vacuumed. It was smoother day two. This full bodied beauty goes great with sharp hard cheeses, grilled red meat, and, of course, dark chocolate. Stellar!

Excellent wine!
Very dark cherry-garnet color, with violet glow.

Very long memorable and elegant finish.
